message_1:
Here is a numerical problem related to Relevance Logic:

Let "P" be the statement "Today is Monday" and "Q" be the statement "It will snow today". 

Determine the truth value of the statement "P → Q" if P is false and Q is true. 

What is the answer?
message_2:
In classical logic, the truth value of the statement "P → Q" (P implies Q) can be determined using the following truth table:

P | Q | P → Q
T | T |   T
T | F |   F
F | T |   T
F | F |   T

Since P is false and Q is true (F | T), the truth value of the statement "P → Q" is true.
